ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Network setup help
ygData.msgSnippet: The default is usually admin unless you changed it. Yes you should change it but one never knows. I use a Siemens and love it Rob ...
ygData.messageBody:
The default is usually admin unless you changed it.
Yes you should change it but one never knows.

I use a Siemens and love it

Rob

--- WULF Tech <wulftech@...> wrote:
> And to clarify, the usernamepassword is NOT the
> username/password you use for your DSL account. It
> is a Username/password that is specific to your
> router. The router documentation should have that
> info. If not, go to Linksys' webpage and search for
> the model router you have, and they generally have a
> link on how to retrieve/reset the user/pass.
>
>
> Wulfric
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Thomas H. Comegys
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, August 12, 2002 1:15 AM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Network setup help
>
>
> We have discussed that very same problem in guild
> email, and here is what
> one of our members came up with... this is a
> copy/paste from their message:
>
> 1) You have to be using a Linksys (not sure of
> other router interfaces)
>
> 2) Open a browser window and go to 192.168.1.1 (It
> may take a while to open)
>
> 3) Enter your user name and password
>
> 4) Click on the button labeled ADVANCED
>
> 5) Click on the tab labeled FORWARDING
>
> 6) Insert the values 1024 and 7000 under the
> heading of Ext.Port
>
> 7) Make sure there are check marks in Protocols
> UDP and UTP
>
> 8) Fill in the last octet of each IP address on
> your network, then clik the
> box under ENABLE.
>
> 9) Click on the button labeled APPLY, at the
> bottom of the screen.
>
> Reboot when it says.
>
> 10) Go to your router's web site and look for
> firmware upgrades whenever
> your EQ connection seems abnormally laggy or you
> get multiple disconnects
> for no apparent reason.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Ariaya" <ariaya@...>
> To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2002 10:20 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Network setup help
>
>
> > Hi,
> >
> > I'm hoping that someone on this board can help.
> I just installed an
> > at home network with an ethernet DSL modem, 2
> computers and a LinkSys
> > router (with switch built in).
> >
> > For some reason, the router seems to be making
> me disconnect from EQ
> > VERY frequently! 9 or 10 times a night!!
> >
> > I unplugged the router and just plugged the
> computer into the modem
> > and everything worked.
> >
> > Any suggestions on how I can get this network
> going?
> >
> > Ariaya, Ranger
> > Fariaya, Enchanter
> > Cariaya, Bard
> > Wariaya, Beastlord
> > All on Terris Thule Server
